result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather Lynn Guard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Battery to Emergency Rescue Worker [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(7)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court urges participation in programming while incarcerated.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharge - to be paid during extended supervision

Not allowed to vote or sit on jury until civil rights are restored.  No contact with C.K., N.P., N.R., or their immediate families.  May send apologies in writing - must be approved by prison social worker.    Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.    Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Not to consume or possess any prescription medication without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.  May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Pay court obligations and DOC supervision fees.  Obtain or maintain full-time employment.  Def must give DNA sample today.  AODA assessment followed by treatment and any other assessments as recommended by agent.

supervisions.notes: ***Extended Supervision amended to 18 months per Court decision 12-17-19***

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
